Anna Michalak is the Director of the Climate and Resilience Hub at the Carnegie Institution for Science and Professor (by courtesy) of Earth System Science at Stanford. She works on characterizing the global carbon cycle and on climate impacts on coastal and inland water quality.

## Education

- [PhD in Civil and Environmental Engineering]{.fw-bold} | Stanford University | 2003
- [MS in Civil and Environmental Engineering]{.fw-bold} | Stanford University | 1998
- [BSc(Eng) in Environmental Engineering]{.fw-bold} | University of Guelph, Canada  | 1997  

## Professional Experience

- [2011-present:]{.fw-bold} 	Faculty member and Director, 	Carnegie Institution for Science 
- [2011-present:]{.fw-bold} 	Professor (2016 - ) and Associate Professor (2011-2016), Stanford 
- [2004-2011:]{.fw-bold} 	Associate Professor (2010-2011) and Assistant Professor (2004-2010), University of Michigan 
- [2003- 2004:]{.fw-bold}	NOAA Climate & Global Change (C&GC) Fellow, NOAA\\
